result.execSummary:
The defendant Oscar Santiago Bautista was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation on counts 1&2 to run concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified

miscConds.notes:
Costs of the action paid from bond previously posted.  
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request. Defendant shall complete a sex offender evaluation.

The defendant shall have no contact with C.G. or family or residence  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

Defendant is not to use the internet, facebook or use electronic devices without the consent of the agent and any treatment provider

Defendant is not to have contact with minors under age 18 with exception of incidental public contact, immediate family or the children of a significant other with permission of the agent.

timeConds.notes: Jail time assessed on count 1 only. Defendant granted credit for 28 days served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
